evidence.source_document: Plaintiff's Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text:
Case 1:25-cv-00385-ABJ Document 2 Filed 02/10/25 Page 1 of 3
Plaintiff’s Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
Plaintiff Hampton Dellinger hereby requests…

extracted.value: Plaintiff’s Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order (filed February 10, 2025) – Hampton Dellinger requests the court to issue a temporary restraining order to prevent President Trump’s removal of Dellinger and to enjoin defendants from treating him as removed.

Defendants’ Opposition to Plaintiff’s Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
Defendants oppose the TRO…

extracted.value: Defendants’ Opposition to Plaintiff’s Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order (filed February 11, 2025) – Defendants oppose the TRO, arguing it is premature and that the court should deny the motion.

extracted.value: Defendants’ Motion for Summary Judgment (filed February 21, 2025) – Defendants seek summary judgment under Rule 56(a), requesting the court to enter judgment in their favor.

evidence.source_document: Appellee's Motion to Dismiss as Moot
evidence.text:
CERTIFICATE OF SERVICE
I hereby certify that on March 7, 2025, I electronically filed the foregoing motion…

extracted.value: Appellee’s Motion to Dismiss as Moot (filed March 7, 2025) – Hampton Dellinger files a motion to dismiss the appeal on the ground that it is moot, requesting dismissal with costs.

evidence.source_document: Application to Vacate the Order Issued by the U.S. District Court and Request for an Immediate Administrative Stay
evidence.text:
APPLICATION TO VACATE THE ORDER ISSUED BY THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND REQUEST FOR AN IMMEDIATE ADMINISTRATIVE STAY
SARAH M. HARRIS
Acting Solicitor General
Counsel of Record

extracted.value: Application to Vacate the Order Issued by the U.S. District Court and Request for an Immediate Administrative Stay – Applicants request the Supreme Court to vacate the district court’s order and grant an immediate stay pending appeal.

evidence.source_document: Defendants’ Motion to Stay the Court's Order Pending Appeal
evidence.text: DEFENDANTS’ MOTION TO STAY THE COURT’S ORDER PENDING APPEAL Plaintiff filed this action on February 10, 2025, ECF No. 1, challenging the President’s decision to remove him as Special Counsel on February 7, 2025. Plaintiff also moved for a temporary restraining order, ECF No. 2. Later that day, the Court entered an “administrative stay,” ordering Plaintiff to be reinstated as Special Counsel through midnight on February 13. See February 10, 2025 Minute Order. On February 12, 2025, the Court granted Plaintiff’s motion for a temporary restraining order, requiring that Plaintiff “shall continue to serve as the Special Counsel” and that Defendants “may not deny him access to the resources or materials of that office or recognize the authority of any other person as Special Counsel.” Order, ECF No. 14.

extracted.value: Defendants’ Motion to Stay the Court’s Order Pending Appeal (filed February 10, 2025) – Defendants request the court to stay the district court’s administrative stay pending appeal.
